result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: DE not competent to stand trial, case suspended

records.addlTxt: Defendant Thomas John Overland in court with attorney Debra Van Wormer O'Rourke.  Michael X. Albrecht appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Hearing under 971.13.  State and Attorney ORourke received report of Dr Berney.  No further comment.   Defendant agrees with no further comment re: competency.  Court finds there has been waiver to provide further testimony.  Report accepted.  Finds defendant is no competent to proceed at this time.  Competency could not be restored, per Dr.'s report.  Parties indicate report language re: not able to restore competency.  Attorney ORourke believes matter will be suspended.  15ME224 case is pending in Milwaukee County.  Treatment on outpatient basis.  Warrant quashed.  State agrees matter will be suspended.  Court suspends action according to statutes.
Competency hearing on February 11, 2015 at 09:45 am.
of Dr. Berney $1785.00
further stay warrant until 2/10/15
Hearing on January 16, 2015 at 01:00 pm.

Attorney Debra V. O'Rourke in court.  Michael X. Albrecht appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty. ORourke has not heard from DE but have gotten the report on competency.  Kept in contact with Milwaukee Mental Health and they have not heard from DE either.  Court states statute says DE needs to be here and agree.    Based on non-appearance, court authorized warrant but stayed until 1/16/15 and forfeit bond if warrant issues.  Hearing scheduled for January 16, 2015 at 01:00 pm.
Competency hearing on January 5, 2015 at 09:45 am.

Attorney Debra V. O'Rourke in court.  Michael Albrecht appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court states case and parties state appearances.  Atty O'Rourke doesn't know why DE isn't here.  She hasn't been able to reach him by phone.  Requests any warrant be stayed as she has never had any problem staying in contact w/the DE.  State is in agreement.  Court authorizes warrant but advises Atty O'Rourke to get a court date from his assistant after court and the warrant will be stayed until that date.
Competency hearing on December 17, 2014 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Thomas John Overland in court with attorney Debra V. O'Rourke.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty O'Rourke requests competency matter be addressed.  She has prepared an order for Dr. Birney to do the exam.  State is an agreement.  Court orders competency eval be completed and Dr. Birney is approved.  Bond continued.  Return date scheduled for October 21, 2014 at 01:00 pm.

Pre-trial conference on August 8, 2014 at 10:00 am.
Return date on August 19, 2014 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Thomas John Overland appeared by video means. Prosecuting Atty Sue Mueller appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives reading of complaint.  State gives criminal history.  State request $2500.00 cash bond w/ conditions.  Attorney Woodard request $500 cash.  Defendant denies alot of criminal history stated by State.  Advised rights to an attorney.  Time limits waived.  $1000.00 CASH bond set.  Special bond conditions as follows:  Not to oper MV w/out valid DL, absolute sobriety at all times and must submit chemical testing by law enforcement.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 8, 2014 at 10:00 am.  Return date scheduled for August 19, 2014 at 01:00 pm.
